de.team33.libs.reflect.v4

Interface Fields.Naming

  • All Superinterfaces:
    Function<Field,String>
    Enclosing class:
    Fields
    Functional Interface:
    This is a functional interface and can therefore be used as the assignment target for a lambda expression or method reference.

    @FunctionalInterface
public static interface Fields.Naming
extends Function<Field,String>
    Defines some typical Functions that serve to find a name for a Field.

    • Field Summary

      Fields 
      Modifier and Type Field and Description
      static Fields.Naming CANONICAL
      A Function that returns a canonical, full qualified name for a given Field.
      static Fields.Naming SIMPLE
      A Function that simply returns the plain name of a given Field.

    • Method Summary

      All Methods Static Methods Default Methods 
      Modifier and Type Method and Description
      static Fields.Naming compact(Class<?> context)
      Returns a Function that returns the plain name of a particular field preceded by a prefix.
      static Fields.Naming conditional(Class<?> context)
      Returns a Function that simply returns the plain name of a given Field if inquired in the context of the Field's declaring class.

      • Methods inherited from interface java.util.function.Function

        andThen, apply, compose, identity

    • Field Detail

      • SIMPLE

        static final Fields.Naming SIMPLE
        A Function that simply returns the plain name of a given Field.

      • CANONICAL

        static final Fields.Naming CANONICAL
        A Function that returns a canonical, full qualified name for a given Field.

    • Method Detail

      • compact

        static Fields.Naming compact(Class<?> context)
        Returns a Function that returns the plain name of a particular field preceded by a prefix. The prefix consists of a sequence of dots (".") whose length reflects the hierarchy depth of the declaring class of the field against a class given as a context. If the class given as context is the declaring class of the field, then the prefix has the length zero, so that the resulting name is finally the same as the simple name of the Field.

      • conditional

        static Fields.Naming conditional(Class<?> context)
        Returns a Function that simply returns the plain name of a given Field if inquired in the context of the Field's declaring class. Otherwise it returns a canonical, full qualified name.
